qas.question: Why do researches in homosexual studies argued that it is a social and historical constuction?

answers.text: Because sexual orientation is complex and multi-dimensional

qas.question: Which philosopher argued homosexuality did not exist as an idenity in the eighteenth century?
In what year did Michel Foucalt publish The History Of Sexuality?
What did he state was an invention of the modern state?
What was a crime in the eighteenth century that could cause severe punishment but was mostly ignored?

context: <a0_0>Because sexual orientation is complex and multi-dimensional<a0_0/>, some academics and researchers, especially in queer studies, have argued that it is a historical and social construction. In <a2_0>1976<a2_0/>, philosopher and historian <a1_0>Michel Foucault<a1_0/> argued in The History of Sexuality that homosexuality as an identity did not exist in the eighteenth century; that people instead spoke of "sodomy," which referred to sexual acts. <a4_0>Sodomy<a4_0/> was a crime that was often ignored, but sometimes punished severely (see sodomy law). He wrote, "<a3_0>'Sexuality<a3_0/>' is an invention of the modern state, the industrial revolution, and capitalism."
